DOC.brief_summary: Objectives : To determine efficacy low rate fluoroscopy 7.5 frame per second ( FPS ) vs. conventional 15 FPS reduction operator patient radiation dose diagnostic coronary angiography percutaneous coronary intervention via transradial approach . Background : Transradial approach cardiac catheterization potentially associate increased radiation exposure . Low rate fluoroscopy potential reduce radiation exposure .
DOC.brief_title: Low Rate Fluoroscopy Reduce Radiation Dose During Coronary Angiography Intervention
DOC.detailed_description: Methods : Patients undergo transradial approach diagnostic angiography ± ad hoc PCI , wil randomize fluoroscopy 7.5 FPS vs. 15 FPS prior procedure . Both 7.5 15 FPS fluoroscopy protocol configure fix dose per pulse 40 nGy . Primary endpoint operator radiation dose ( measure dosimeter attach left side thyroid shield µSv ) , patient radiation dose ( express dose-area product μGy.m2 ) , fluoroscopy time .
DOC.criteria: Patients undergo elective , urgent emergent cardiac catheterization procedure without ad hoc PCI , via transradial approach eligible . 1 ) nontransradial access 2 ) participation research project ( ) require high ie 30 FPS cine angiography .
